arm_group.description: A focus group (group of experts) such as physicians, nurses, or other professionals invited by the investigator.

Adults who are contacts of newborns or expecting mothers in their last trimester of pregnancy or their partners. The data of the subjects in this group will be analysed using the adaptive choice based conjoint (ACBC) technique.

Adults who are contacts of newborns or expecting mothers in their last trimester of pregnancy or their partners. The data of the subjects in this group will be analysed using the standard discrete choice experiment (DCE) technique.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to establish an effective method to inform parents or close relatives of
      newborns about the risk of pertussis transmission to newborns and the advantages offered by
      the cocooning strategy (vaccinating those who are in close contact with the newborn) by
      assessing the factors that affect the parents' decision-making to accept pertussis
      immunisation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing Contacts' Decision Making on Reducing the Risk of Pertussis Transmission to Newborns Through Immunisation

detailed_description.textblock:
Two phases are foreseen in the study. The 'questionnaire design' phase will be conducted in
      order to finalise the electronic questionnaire. The enrollment phase will involve the
      administration of the final web-based questionnaires to the subjects included in the
      enrollment phase.

      The data generated in this study will be useful to inform parents of newborns about the
      advantages of vaccinating people who are in close contact with the newborn even before the
      baby is born in order to prevent the transmission of pertussis to the newborn.

      No vaccine will be administered during this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects who the investigator believes that, can and will comply with the
             requirements of this protocol (ability to understand the study objectives and the
             questions asked, and ability to operate a computer).

          -  Written informed consent obtained from the subject.

          -  Subjects aged ≥ 18 years at the time of study start who are either:

        Contacts of newborns (aged ≤ 6 months). OR Expecting mothers in their last trimester of
        pregnancy or their partners, who will be in close contact with the newborn.

        •  Subjects who will be eligible for pertussis booster vaccination and have not received
        any pertussis vaccination in the last 2 years (before study start).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects who have participated in the 'questionnaire design' phase (applicable only
             for subjects who will participate in the enrollment phase of the study).

          -  Subjects with a contraindication to pertussis vaccination.

          -  Subjects who declare to be in principle against vaccination.

          -  Subjects who declare to be in a chronic physical condition and not compatible with
             vaccination.

          -  Subjects with a history of pertussis in the last 5 years (before study start).

          -  History of non-response to pertussis vaccination.

          -  Subjects with mental deficiency.

          -  Subjects with unstable chronic health condition(s).

study_pop.textblock:
Subjects aged 18 years and above who are either contacts of newborns (aged ≤ 6 months) or
        expecting mothers in their last trimester of pregnancy or their partners, who will be in
        close contact with the newborn.

intervention.description: Data collection will be done via web-based questionnaires generated by Sawtooth Software.  Subjects will be asked for their ideal alternative (acceptance to immunisation) by selecting the factors that suit them the most. The subjects are then presented several sets of alternatives built around their ideal choice.

clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Contacts' Decision Making on Reducing the Risk of Pertussis Transmission to Newborns Through Immunisation, in Italy and Spain

overall_contact.last_name: US GSK Clinical Trials Call Center

oversight_info.authority: Spain: AGENCIA ESPAÑOLA DE MEDICAMENTOS Y PRODUCTOS SANITARIOS (AEMPS)

primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint constitutes the answers collected from all conjoint sections of the adaptive web-based questionnaire.
primary_outcome.measure: The standard choice-based data will be used to assess the quality of the model fitted using the adaptive data. It will also be used for a qualitative comparison of adaptive (ACBC) and standard (CBC) data collection using descriptive approach.
primary_outcome.time_frame: After completion of the questionnaire by all the subjects (Visit 1 i.e. Day 0).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Answers from the two parents (same couple) may be identified for comparison purposes and joint analysis.
secondary_outcome.measure: The secondary endpoints constitute in all, the non-conjoint ancillary data collected through the web-based fixed questionnaire including, but not limited to: gender, age, family composition, education level and ethnicity.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After completion of the questionnaire by all the subjects (Visit 1 i.e. Day 0).

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
